alert.note: Alert for Stark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 3:14PM EST until February 18 at 9:45PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Tuscarawas River At Massillon affecting Stark County. Nimishillen Creek Near North Industry affecting Stark County. Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck affecting Holmes and Wayne Counties. For the Nimishillen Creek...including North Industry...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Nimishillen Creek Near North Industry. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Widespread flooding in southern portions of Canton from Ridge Avenue north to Allenford Drive. Flood waters cut off access to homes along Cheyenne Street and Allenford Drive. Flood waters cut off access to properties on Cleveland Southwest Avenue. Some low lying properties inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EST Friday the stage was 12.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM EST Friday was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 2.3 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 02/28/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 945 PM EST.
